title: Lizzo Wins Part of a Lawsuit About Body Shaming
summary: Pop star Lizzo is happy because a judge said she did not fat-shame her dancers. Some dancers sued her in 2023, saying she made fun of their weight. The judge dismissed that part, but the dancers still have other claims. They say Lizzo made them go to sex shows and touch people without clothes. Lizzo says she fired the dancers for recording her secretly, not for gaining weight. Her team calls the lawsuit a made-up story. The case will continue in court about the sex show claims. Lizzo is known for songs that celebrate all body types.

background_read: Lizzo is a famous singer who promotes body positivity, meaning she encourages people to love their bodies no matter their size. In 2023, three of her former dancers sued her, claiming she treated them badly. The lawsuit has two main parts: one about fat-shaming and one about sexual harassment. A judge recently dismissed the fat-shaming part, but the sexual harassment part will continue. This case shows how celebrities can face legal challenges from their employees.
Article_Structure: WHO: Pop star Lizzo and her former dancers
WHAT: A lawsuit where dancers accused Lizzo of fat-shaming and sexual harassment, with the fat-shaming part dismissed
WHERE: In a Los Angeles court
WHY: To decide if Lizzo treated her dancers unfairly and if the claims are true
